title: Ticket #6484: make public the code to buffer dprintfs for printing later
description:
HTCondor has internal code for buffering dprintf() statements in memory and sending them to the log later. Typically, this is done to store the messages until such time that the debug subsystem has been properly initialized.

However, this would also be useful in critical places where we need debugging information but can't write to the log. The motivating example is in the middle of _set_priv(): We want to have debug messages, but can't actually dprintf() because dprintf() itself calls _set_priv() to be able to write to the log file.

As mentioned, the log buffering functionality already exists... this enhancement just makes it available for calling outside of the dprintf() code, and adds a helper function that takes a (...) parameter (variable number of arguments) just like the regular dprintf().
